Detailed Description

Metric Alarm.

Member Function Documentation

- (void CloudWatchMetricAlarm.)addDimension: (CloudWatchDimension *)  dimension  

Adds a single object to dimensions.

This function will alloc and init dimensions if not already done.

- (NSString * CloudWatchMetricAlarm.)description  

Returns a string representation of this object; useful for testing and debugging.

Returns:
A string representation of this object.
- (id CloudWatchMetricAlarm.)init  

Default constructor for a new object.

Callers should use the property methods to initialize this object after creating it.

Property Documentation

- (NSMutableArray *) alarmActions [read, write, retain]

The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an ALARM state from any other state.

Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only actions supported are publishing to an Amazon SNS topic and triggering an Auto Scaling policy.

Constraints:
Length: 0 - 5

- (NSString *) alarmArn [read, write, retain]

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alarm.

Constraints:
Length: 1 - 1600

- (NSString *) alarmDescription [read, write, retain]

The description for the alarm.

Constraints:
Length: 0 - 255

- (NSString *) alarmName [read, write, retain]

The name of the alarm.

Constraints:
Length: 1 - 255

- (NSString *) comparisonOperator [read, write, retain]

The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified Statistic and Threshold.

The specified Statistic value is used as the first operand.

Constraints:
Allowed Values: GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold, GreaterThanThreshold, LessThanThreshold, LessThanOrEqualToThreshold

- (NSMutableArray *) dimensions [read, write, retain]

The list of dimensions associated with the alarm's associated metric.

Constraints:
Length: 0 - 10

- (NSNumber *) evaluationPeriods [read, write, retain]

The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

Constraints:
Range: 1 -

- (NSMutableArray *) insufficientDataActions [read, write, retain]

The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an INSUFFICIENT_DATA state from any other state.

Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only actions supported are publishing to an Amazon SNS topic or triggering an Auto Scaling policy.

Constraints:
Length: 0 - 5

- (NSString *) metricName [read, write, retain]

The name of the alarm's metric.

Constraints:
Length: 1 - 255

- (NSMutableArray *) oKActions [read, write, retain]

The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an OK state from any other state.

Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN). Currently the only actions supported are publishing to an Amazon SNS topic and triggering an Auto Scaling policy.

Constraints:
Length: 0 - 5

- (NSNumber *) period [read, write, retain]

The period in seconds over which the statistic is applied.

Constraints:
Range: 60 -

- (NSString *) stateReason [read, write, retain]

A human-readable explanation for the alarm's state.

Constraints:
Length: 0 - 1023

- (NSString *) stateReasonData [read, write, retain]

An explanation for the alarm's state in machine-readable JSON format.

Constraints:
Length: 0 - 4000

- (NSString *) stateValue [read, write, retain]

The state value for the alarm.

Constraints:
Allowed Values: OK, ALARM, INSUFFICIENT_DATA

- (NSString *) statistic [read, write, retain]

The namespace of alarm's associated metric.

Constraints:
Length: 1 - 255
Pattern: [^:].*
The statistic to apply to the alarm's associated metric.

Constraints:
Allowed Values: SampleCount, Average, Sum, Minimum, Maximum

- (NSString *) unit [read, write, retain]

The unit of the alarm's associated metric.

Constraints:
Allowed Values: Seconds, Microseconds, Milliseconds, Bytes, Kilobytes, Megabytes, Gigabytes, Terabytes, Bits, Kilobits, Megabits, Gigabits, Terabits, Percent, Count, Bytes/Second, Kilobytes/Second, Megabytes/Second, Gigabytes/Second, Terabytes/Second, Bits/Second, Kilobits/Second, Megabits/Second, Gigabits/Second, Terabits/Second, Count/Second, None
